A lower F0 typically, but not always, suggests a male voice due to the larger vocal folds. I will also be considering the formant frequencies, and how they relate to the vocal tract shape. I know this isn't a perfect science, because these can overlap, so I will have to be very rigorous in analyzing the data. I'll also pay attention to any harmonic structure, the presence of any vocal fry or creak (more common in certain gendered speech patterns, but not exclusively so), and any other subtle acoustic features that might provide discriminatory information. I'll then synthesize my analysis into a final prediction.
